Plugins view in action

Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1. There is a plugin for Eclipse which displays graphical figures in its editor part and uses thumbnail view in the Outline View to show small version of the editor's content.

2. Outline View is synchronized with the editor, if mouse selects same region in the Outline this region gets focus in the editor, dragging the region is available.

3. Seldom when reopening the editor view and doing mouse clicking and dragging in the Outline the exception is thrown.

4. During debugging in the event queue mouseDragged event comes before mouseClicked event. Thus startLocation variable is not initialized.

5. My plugun's classes do NOT override the default behavior of the IFigure or other core Eclipse classes.

In other words:
This exception occurs in the private class ScrollSynchronizer of the ScrollableThumbnail  class when mouseDragged() method is called before mousePressed() method. The cause is that variable startLocation is set only in the mousePressed() method and than is used in mouseDragged(). If  mouseDragged() called first this variable is null and exception is thrown.

See also the same problem on dev.eclipse.org:
http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.tools.gef/msg07255.html
